newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Weak bullion knocks S.African golds to close down.
newsitem.headline: Weak bullion knocks S.African golds to close down.

text.p: South African gold shares took a battering on Wednesday as the bullion price lost all Tuesday's gains and fell to $351 an ounce, threatening to test the key $350 an ounce level.
Having climbed nearly five percent on Tuesday, riding the brief rally in the gold price, gold shares shed more than three percent.
Dealers said the strong rand -- last bid at 4.5600 against the dollar -- had compounded weakness by eroding any support metal stocks might have won from it.
The gold index lost 43.8 points to 1,385.3 points.
Dealers said that a significant end to losses on the gold board was unlikely to take place in the near future.
Industrial shares also took a bashing, with the index shedding 48.5 points to 6,687.5.
Local shares were punished by volatility on Wall Street, which saw the U.S. stock market gain 100 points before shredding these gains to end weaker.
Overall trade had been mixed, dealers said.
Weakness in golds and industrials combined to knock the all-share index 48.5 points down to 6,687.5.
